    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRTextViewSceneObject

        public GVRTextViewSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                              float width,
                              float height,
                              java.lang.CharSequence text)
        Shows a TextView on a scene object with view's default height and width.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        width - Scene object height, in GVRF scene graph units.
        height - Scene object's width, in GVRF scene graph units.
        text - CharSequence to show on the textView

      • GVRTextViewSceneObject

        public GVRTextViewSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                              java.lang.CharSequence text)
        Shows a TextView on a scene object with both view's default height and width and quad's default height and width.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        text - CharSequence to show on the textView

      • GVRTextViewSceneObject

        public GVRTextViewSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Shows a TextView on a scene object with both view's default height and width and quad's default height and width. The initial text will be the private DEFAULT_TEXT constant, or "".
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext

      • GVRTextViewSceneObject

        public GVRTextViewSceneObject(GVRContext gvrContext,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String string,
                              java.lang.String font,
                              GVRTextViewSceneObject.justifyTypes justify,
                              float spacing,
                              float size,
                              GVRTextViewSceneObject.fontStyleTypes style)
        Constructs a GVRTextViewSceneObject that will be on a plane contoured to the size of the longest line of text and the number of lines of text.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - current GVRContext
        name - In X3D, it's the name of the FontStyle, not the Text node
        string - Text to be displayed, with lines separated by '\n' newline character
        font - Font Family for this text. If not the default font, the ttf font file should be in the assets folder.
        justify - Will either be left, right or centered, based on the enumerated type file
        spacing - Additional spacing between the lines of text
        size - Font character size, default is 1.
        style - Specifies plain, bold, italic or bolditalic based on enumerated type value

    • Method Detail

      • setTextSize

        public void setTextSize(float size)
        Set the text size. Note that Android's TextView.setTextSize modifies the size value Thus size, and getTextSize() will not be the same results
        Parameters:
        size - The new text size.

      • getTextSize

        public float getTextSize()
        Get the current text size.
        Returns:
        The current text size modified and saved within Android's TextView class.

      • getSize

        public float getSize()
        getSize is the size saved within GVRTextViewSceneObject and differs from the textSize modified within Android's TextView class.
        Returns:
        The font character size

        public void setTextColor(int color)
        Set the text color.
        Parameters:
        color - The text color, in Android Color format. The alpha component is ignored.

        Get the current text, as a String. This is a convenience function, 100% equivalent to getText() .toString()

        Parameters:

      • getLineLength

        public float getLineLength(java.lang.String text)
        returns the length of this line based in pixels and dependent on the font family and size of the characters.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:
        The length in pixels where the text ends. It measures with the start point of 0 instead where the the text begins.

      • setJustification

        public void setJustification(GVRTextViewSceneObject.justifyTypes justify)
        set the justification to left, center/middle or right. The values from the enumerated type are from X3D's justify setting.
        Parameters:
        justify -

      • getJustification

        public GVRTextViewSceneObject.justifyTypes getJustification()
        Returns the justification type defined the enumerated type. If none is set, it returns null. Note that the value saved is not the value returned for setGravity(LEFT) and setGravity(RIGHT). 0x30 is added to those values by Android's TextView.setGravity()
        Returns:
        The justification type

      • setTypeface

        public boolean setTypeface(GVRContext gvrContext,
                           java.lang.String font)
        Sets the typeface (font)
        Parameters:
        gvrContext -
        font - a string that matches the font name saved in the assets directory Must include the file ending such as "myFont.ttf"
        Returns:
        True if font is changed else false

      • setTypeface

        public boolean setTypeface(GVRContext gvrContext,
                           java.lang.String font,
                           GVRTextViewSceneObject.fontStyleTypes style)
        Sets the typeface (font)
        Parameters:
        gvrContext -
        font - a string that matches the font name saved in the assets directory Must include the file ending such as "myFont.ttf"
        style - value for style from the enumerated list that matches values from X3D style setting
        Returns:
        True if font is changed else false

        public GVRTextViewSceneObject.fontStyleTypes getStyleType()

      • setRefreshFrequency

        public void setRefreshFrequency(GVRTextViewSceneObject.IntervalFrequency frequency)
        Set the refresh frequency of this scene object. Use NONE for improved performance when the text is set initially and never changed.
        Parameters:
        frequency - The refresh frequency of this TextViewSceneObject.
